articles.title: Archaeologists Determine Ancient Origins of Cache of 35 Wooden Tools Found in China
articles.description: A joint team of archaeologists, chronologists, geologists, and paleontologists have successfully dated a hoard of wooden tools recovered nearly a decade ago, placing their creation around 300,000 years ago, near the end of the Early Paleolithic Period.

articles.title: Peru Unveils Sacred City of Caral Hidden for Nearly 4,000 Years
articles.description: After eight years of excavations, intense research, and conservation work, Peru has unveiled Pe√±ico, a 'city of social integration' that connected populations of the Supe and Huaura valleys, featuring numerous homes, public buildings, and ceremonial spaces.

articles.title: Archaeologist Claims to Have Found Atlantis in Groundbreaking Discovery
articles.description: Archaeologist Michael Donnellan claims to have identified the lost city of Atlantis two miles off the coast of Cadiz, Spain, presenting images obtained through underwater technology at the Cosmic Summit 2025 conference.
